pageContext.description: Damaged as shown. Fractured edges patinated as surfaces. Blade has been sharpened from one side.
pageContext.associations: Probably part of Nether Wallop hoard; 6 pieces in British Museum and 1 in Salisbury. Found with three other damaged axes and one fragment, No's. 14/50A & B, 226/48 A & C.
pageContext.publications: ?Unpublished,C.N. Moore and E. R. Lewis, Proc. H. F. C., XXVI, 1969, 19.
pageContext.collection: City of Portsmouth Museums,(Cumberland House Museum, Southsea),Accessions No. 226/48B,Given to the Museum by the finder: Miss W. M. Spyers, 3 Weston Road, Petersfield, Hampshire, in 1948.,In Southsea Castle
pageContext.site: England,Wiltshire (?Hampshire),Nether Wallop,"Found in 1925, under bracken about 1/2 mile N.W. of Nether Wallop".
pageContext.toSearch: Nether Wallop, Stockbridge, Hampshire So20, UK
pageContext.remarks: Part of a hoard of damaged axes and fragments.
